Manual Sapling Transplanter

Brief background Transplantation is the process of transplanting specifically raised saplings or seedlings on the field with desired spacing. Transplanting and planting vegetables in traditional way, is a hard job and dependent on women farmer. In addition, land preparation and transplantation should be done in a period of short time as per season. Conventional method of transplanting is not a healthy method as the farmers have to bend from waist and stoop while transplanting saplings which cause health hazard later on. Therefore, mechanical transplanting of vegetable’s seedlings is necessary to save labour, time and energy costs and to mitigate drudgery of women of extreme forward trunk flexion. Manual sapling transpalnter is a good option for this. Technology Description (Technical) A Sapling Trans planter was introduced to plant vegetable saplings and was field tested for its efficacy in comparison to back breaking conventional method of transplanting. It’s a simple manual tool, having a metallic tube. The trans planter has a hole at the bottom to plant in the standing position. A pair of trowels can penetrate in the soil as well as right through plastic mulching as well. In order to operate the tool, drop a seedling into guide tube, push the shut pair of trowels into the soil, grasp the latch and handle together and lift the tool straight up. The tool was tested for planting tomato saplings. The specific advantages of using the tool are: The operator can stand straight (no need to bend down) for planting the seedling making the process easy. One manual planter can equal 4 person’s working at a time providing high efficiency. It can be used with single or both the hands. Economical and easy to operate. Suitable not only for farmers but also for anyone who loves gardening. How it is women friendly The hand-held manual transplanter allows one person to plant hundreds of seedlings per hour. This tool can be used with prepared seed- beds either through plastic mulching sheets or bare soil. Used for planting seedlings of vegetables like, Tomato, Brinjal, and Chilly.
Performance Convenient, time saving, improves Posture, reduced MSD Locale of Dissemination/ Application Rural areas of Udaipur and adjoining areas Outcome/ Impact/ Benefits The Physiological cost of work is reduced. Time Saved, Economical, Reduced MSD, Increased convenience. Limitations if any The transplanter base should be dry and field should be watered after transplanting the saplings Photographs
